title: quarkus-smallrye-jwt dependency brokes quarkus-amazon-lambda support
body:
### Describe the bug

If the dependency `quarkus-smallrye-jwt` is added to the project generated by
```
mvn archetype:generate \
       -DarchetypeGroupId=io.quarkus \
       -DarchetypeArtifactId=quarkus-amazon-lambda-archetype \
       -DarchetypeVersion=2.4.1.Final
```
Then the generated unit test `LambdaHandlerTest` will fail. I tried it because I integrated `quarkus-smallrye-jwt` in a project having `quarkus-amazon-lambda` and I was not able to successful run the lambda handler unit test, so I tried starting from scratch with the generated project and I'm having the same issue.
The stacktrace is the following:
```

```

### Expected behavior

`quarkus-smallrye-jwt` is supported together with `quarkus-amazon-lambda`

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

1. Generate a project with
```
mvn archetype:generate \
       -DarchetypeGroupId=io.quarkus \
       -DarchetypeArtifactId=quarkus-amazon-lambda-archetype \
       -DarchetypeVersion=2.4.1.Final
```
2. Add this in dependencies:
```
<dependency>
	<groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
	<artifactId>quarkus-smallrye-jwt</artifactId>
</dependency>

```
3. Run the JUnit test in class `LambdaHandlerTest`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.12" 2021-07-20

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.4.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.2 (ea98e05a04480131370aa0c110b8c54cf726c06f)

### Additional information

Running on Windows
